instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: Can i get support  here for an alienware area 51m r1?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
No problem.
We already helped to solve some Alienware machines here.

Post the motherboard model first.
Is more easy to work with schematic in front.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: the model is la-g881p. someone attempted to replace the keyboard and after reassembling it, the board showed power briefly and then no power at all. It looks very clean with no burns of anything. I checked capacitors and I didn't find any with paths the ground on both sides. when the battery and the chargers are plugged in I get 3v and 5v on PL301 and PL302. 12 v is on the battery terminal. 16v is on PL111 and PL112.  Will this board power up without the DGFF graphics card attached?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: Check for drop pulse at ON/OFF# signal, when pressing power button.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: on/off goes from 3v to ground when pressing the button

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
Check for drop pulse at PBTN_OUT# (at same time).
If detect it, check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_R#.
If not, check if EC_RSMRST# is steady high.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: no 3v on pbtn_out#. the signal isn't pulled to ground either. there is 3v on  pin 1 of rh2. EC_RMST# is 0v

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
So PBTN_OUT# is steady 0V?
It should be 3V and must drop to 0V at same time with ON/OFF#.

In this case, check VCIN1_AC_IN and LID_SW#.
Be sure to use the correct charger!

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: pin 1 of DH1 is 3v.  re70 is 3v on both sides. PBTN_OUT# doesn't react at all to pressing the power button. I don't have the dgff graphics card attached

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
Possibly EC ROM corruption.
I didn't see information about KB9542 yet.
May be programmed in some way like KB9x12, I hope; you should try.
The big problem is to find corresponding file...

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: will this board power up without the dgff graphics card attached?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
PBTN_OUT# should react for sure, without graphics card.
Without its reaction, PCH will not start power on sequence.
At the moment, seems to have problems with KBC, which controls this signal.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: If a brand new KBC is installed then it might be autoprogrammed by the spirom?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
NO, KBC must boot first.

Main BIOS (UH4) is probably not powered up in your case, I suppose.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: +1.8VALW seems to be missing. doesn't that rail help to power the EC?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: that seems to be dependent on the EC. nevermind

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: the ec is labled as 9022QD in the schematic. would that be replacement for kb9542Q

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: JDBG  seems to be the designated place on the mainboard for programming the EC

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: the kbc doesn't get detected by the programmer

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
KB9012/22 have dedicated pins for flashing.
These pins are fixed on the chip, but their place on keyboard connector differs, depending on board model.
[U]Supposing[/U] KB9542 uses the same pins, find their distribution on the keyboard connector.
Then use Vertyanov, SVOD, or RT809H for programming.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i tried detecting the controller using a ch341 with no luck

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
Don't waste time with that.
Get correct KBC programmer, if you want to continue.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i was able to backup the original kb9542 even though it was detected as a kb9010 with the rt809. Could you tell me if this file is corrupt or if the chp is defective

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
You should compare with another dump, form similar board.
Try to find it on Internet...

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i'm new at working with non apple circuitry so when you say similar do you mean another dell with the same chipset as this model?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
Should be good to get a dump from exact same board model.

I suppose one dump from a KB9524 may help you to compare also.
But will not confirm if your reading is good, or not.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i bought a board off ebay and it seems to have the same issue. pbtn_out# isn't 3v and doesn't pulse.   Could this be a bad PCH?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
KBC controls this signal.
Is a low chance that PCH blocks it to work correctly.

Be sure other signals expected by KBC are good; like standby power, lid, charger presence, reset.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: Can't seem to find the exact EC dump but i  flashed it with a random file and now it powers up but the power button is flashing a error code and it doesn't post. Is there a bios recovery method that will correct the EC also?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
So EC ROM was indeed corrupted.
Many brands have EC ROM included in the main BIOS; not sure if is the case here.
Just search for coincidence between both; need to read main BIOS of your board, or find a dump on Internet.
You can also do a search inside the files extracted from official Dell update.

Upload somewhere the EC ROM actually used and your main BIOS.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: I copied the EC from the other matching board and now this one is working. I forgot to mention that I also found and programmed files to UH4  UT2 AND UE2. i'm guessing that those three files will get the other board up and running

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: You can share them, in case other member need in the future...

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i found those very easily with a google search but not the EC contents.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: I still have no luck with the other board after writing to the firmware chips. I'm noticing that Pbtn_out is still missing.  lid_sw# is 3v and  VCIN1_AC_IN  is 3v.  I used the EC firmware from this one to make the other one work

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: it all seems to be EC related. I reinstalled the EC contents and now PBTN_OUT#  is 3v but it doesn't pulse .   I'll erase and reload it a few times and see what happens.  At least I have one working board from all this

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: this one is odd. pbtn_out# does pulse but in reverse. it goes up from 0v to 3v then then back 0v

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
Probably +3V_PCH is not maintained, or not even generated.

Check for pulse at PM_SLP signals, at same time.
Also check if EC_RSMRST# goes high.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: the lack of signal EC_RSMRST# seems to be the root.  it doesn't pulse or anything. pm_slp_s5 does pulse  just like the rest of signals and inital voltages

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
PCH can't start power on sequence, if EC_RSMRST# is kept low (active).
What about +3V_PCH?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: +3V_PCH pulses at 3v then drops back to 0v.  pbtn_out# doesn't pulse with the charger unless you hold down the power button for 10 seconds. then it goes from 3v to 0v and stays at 0v but when the power button is pressed it will pulse at 3v. Pbtn_out# will pulse right away with only the battery attached.  What determines the EC_RSMRST signal?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: PL301/2 voltage stable?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
All voltages controlled by PCH_PWR_EN must stay on after pressing power button.
Check if any shorted to ground.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: PL301/2 will pulse.  i notice that +3v_pch measures  .118v even before the enable. Could this be a PCH issue?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
Check for pulse on all big coils.
Be sure none of them is shorted to ground.
Pay atention to PL101 and +1.8VSP.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: well i put the system back together using the "fixed" board and it ran for while until unplugged it and then it would not come back on.  It turns out that pbtn_out# failed again so i flashed the EC and now this board is doing the exact same thing. This is a revision 2 board but i used the firmware files for the original la-g881p (A00). Now I'm convinced that it's all just firmware related

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: do you know here to get the latest version of the vertyanov software?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
5.5 available for download.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://ioprogrammer.com/[/URL]

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: both boards are working now after an EC reprogramming.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: One of the boards has an intel ME issue. It takes about ten seconds to post on a cold boot. I tried to clean the ME section of the dump and the hard drive doesn't detect with a cleared ME.  this board has intel boot guard and i toggled with the setting but still no luck

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
The disk is not detected at all, even in BIOS setup?

Try to change between UEFI and legacy boot mode.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: when i add the clean ME region then the hdd won't detect in the bios. It detects with the old dump. Is there a way to repair the ME without using flash image tool?

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i figured it out.  Had to learn how to properly clear the ME

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message: i have another one of these boards.  the cpu vcore is missing.   Imvp_vr_on is 3.3v.  the fans spin then stop. pm_slp_s4  remains at 3.3v after the fans stop.

threads.title: ALIENWARE AREA 51M R1 NO POWER
threads.message:
If VCORE is enabled, there must be a communication problem between PCH, BIOS and CPU.
Any of them may be the culprit.
Just in case, check all traces, resistors  and capacitors related with VCORE power supply.
